abstract.p: A collection of zooplankton biomass data (wet mass) compiled by Kazuko Odate, sampled from 1951 - 1990 around Japan (Northwest Pacific) available through COPEPOD.

See the cruise summary web page for a detailed list of cruise dates, number of tows and sampled data. Data can be directly downloaded from the COPEPOD website. Coastal & Oceanic Plankton Ecology, Production & Observation Database (COPEPOD) is an on-line global plankton database by NOAA - National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS).

Dataset of Zooplankton Biomass in the Western North Pacific Ocean (1951-1990, K. Odate Collection). This compilation was an effort of the Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute (TNFRI), the Japan Oceanographic Data Center (JODC), and the Marine Information Research Center (MIRC).

[Reference: Kazuko Odate 1991: Distribution of Zooplankton Biomass in the Northwestern Pacific Ocean, 1951-1988: Mean Wet Weight of Collections by Year, Month and 1-degree Squares. Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute, Japan, 370 pp.]

[Reference: Kazuko Odate 1994: Zooplankton Biomass and its Long-Term Variation in the Western North Pacific Ocean, Tohoku Sea Area, JAPAN. The Bulletin of Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute, No.56, 115-173.]

descript.purpose: To provide investigators with an integrated data set of quality-controlled, globally distributed plankton abundance, biomass and composition data, along with co-sampled environmental data.

idinfo.useconst: Cite the COPEPOD Database and the original PI when available.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
